pullRequest.title: Make 4.17 testable on JDK6
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR contains fixes for 4.17 branch to be testable on JDK6.

It downgrades the maven version to 3.2.5 which is capable to run on JDK6
It makes the release script to not create a release to maven central but only a tag on github
Chages the CI script to make a way to define different JDK version for building and different JDK version for running the tests
Chages in test sources as the tests (in contrast to Narayana runtime) were not ready to be run on JDK6

commit.message: [SCRIPTS ONLY] possible to use JDK6 to run tests
Using maven 3.2.5 as the last version working on JDK6
[RELEASE SCRIPT ONLY] 4.17 branch works with tags only not with the binary releases

nodes.bodyText: Is the H2 downgrade definitely required?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -52,7 +52,7 @@ then
   git clean -f -d
   # Add -x (this will delete all files (e.g. IDE, new features) not under source control)
   rm -rf $PWD/localm2repo
-  ./build.sh clean deploy -Dmaven.repo.local=${PWD}/localm2repo -Prelease,all -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests -pl :jbossjts-jacorb,:jbossxts,:jbossjts-integration,:byteman_support,:jbosstxbridge -am
+  ./build.sh clean install -Dmaven.repo.local=${PWD}/localm2repo -Prelease,all -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests -pl :jbossjts-jacorb,:jbossxts,:jbossjts-integration,:byteman_support,:jbosstxbridge -am

nodes.bodyText: Why do we only run the tests on JDK 1.6?
What was the problem with Utils.removeRecursive? Is it using features that aren't in 1.6?
I cannot find any documentation that describes what this env variable does. I can see it skipping some things but shouldn't the build instructions describe what it's for?

nodes.bodyText: Phew, I am so pleased that this is the last change that needs reviewing.
nodes.diffHunk:

+[ $NARAYANA_TESTS = 1 ] && test_narayana "$@"

beforeCommit.message:
[JDK6 compatibility] test changes to fix JDK6 compatibility

* Throwable#getSuppressed is available from JDK7
* do not using java nio methods from JDK7
* fix dependencies to be compatible with JDK6 (H2 and maven enforcer plugin)
* skip tests which does not work on JDK6 because of InitialContext rebind
* not executing 'narayana-full' on tests as assembly was already created
  during build and it fails with JDK6

afterCommit.message:
[JDK6 compatibility] test changes to fix JDK6 compatibility

* Throwable#getSuppressed is available from JDK7
* do not using java nio methods from JDK7
* fix dependencies to be compatible with JDK6 (H2 and maven enforcer plugin)
* skip tests which does not work on JDK6 because of InitialContext rebind
* not executing 'narayana-full' on tests as assembly was already created
  during build and it fails with JDK6

nodes.bodyText:
The pom says 1.6 is used for the source and target which doesn't match this statement:
         <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
          <version>2.3.2</version>
          <configuration>
            <source>1.6</source>
            <target>1.6</target>
            <compilerArgument>-AtranslationFilesPath=${project.basedir}/classes/</compilerArgument>
          </configuration>

Do we need to change the 1.6 parameter?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -123,11 +123,41 @@ function check_if_pull_closed
 function build_narayana {
   echo "Building Narayana"
   cd $WORKSPACE
-  [ $NARAYANA_TESTS = 1 ] && NARAYANA_ARGS= || NARAYANA_ARGS="-DskipTests"
 
-  ./build.sh -Prelease,community,all$OBJECT_STORE_PROFILE -Didlj-enabled=true "$@" $NARAYANA_ARGS $IPV6_OPTS -B clean install
+  # JAVA_HOME_FOR_BUILD can be used in environment if JDK for building Narayana needs to be different from one which runs e.g. tests.
+  # This is an option used for testing on JDK6. The Narayana 4.17 requires JDK7 for building but target version is JDK6.

commit.message:
[JDK6 compatibility] test changes to fix JDK6 compatibility

* Throwable#getSuppressed is available from JDK7
* do not using java nio methods from JDK7
* fix dependencies to be compatible with JDK6 (H2 and maven enforcer plugin)
* skip tests which does not work on JDK6 because of InitialContext rebind
* not executing 'narayana-full' on tests as assembly was already created
  during build and it fails with JDK6

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if we should put a commit like this on master too in case we need to do something similar in future? (ability to run tests with a different JDK)

nodes.bodyText: This looks wrong to me, is it expected?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -124,13 +124,17 @@ function build_narayana {
   echo "Building Narayana"
   cd $WORKSPACE
 
+  # JAVA_HOME_FOR_BUILD can be used in environment if JDK for building Narayana needs to be different from one which runs e.g. tests.
+  # This env property is used e.g. to build Narayana with JDK 1.7 but run the tests with JDK 1.6.
+  # Narayana targets 1.6 byte code. And the java source is limited to 1.6 language features only.
+  # We must build on 1.7 because we are using a JDK API that only exists in JDK 1.7.
   if [ -n "$JAVA_HOME_FOR_BUILD" ]; then
     local pathOriginal="$PATH"
     local javaHomeOriginal="$JAVA_HOME"
     export JAVA_HOME="$JAVA_HOME_FOR_BUILD"
     export PATH="$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH"
   fi
-
+FailAfterPrepareBase.java
